Before we reommend a language for you, we would love to ask.
There are two major operating systems (iOS, and Android), which would you love to build apps on?

options.title: Android
options.more_info: Android OS is owned and maintained by Google. It is the operating system that powers Samsung, Infinix, Gionee, Pixel, Tecno, etc

options.title: iOS
options.more_info: iOS is owned and maintained by Apple. It is the operating system that powers Iphones, Ipads, Apple watch

options.title: Both
options.more_info: You can develop both Android and iOS apps, no restrictions from any of the corporations at all

options.title: Learn one language and use in both platforms
options.more_info: Rather than learning different languages for iOS and Android, you can learn one and use in both platforms. Such languages are called cross-platform languages

options.more_info: As the Swift/Objective-C language is to iOS, so is the Kotlin/Java language is to Android. You can learn two different languages for the two different platforms

javascript.title:
With React Native & ReactJS (a JavaScript library) you can build a mobile apps for both iOS and Android
Below is the roadmap to take in learning React Native

options.title: Learn CSS
options.more_info: CSS is a stylesheet for styling web pages. With a basic knowledge of CSS you can style applications using React Native

options.title: Learn JavaScript
options.more_info: Everything in React Native will involve JavaScript. So it is expedient you learn and know enough JavaScript before moving to React Native

options.title: Learn ReactJS
options.more_info: ReactJS is a JavaScript library for building web apps. React Native uses ReactJS to build mobile apps. Learn React, understand the concepts, practice with it; and get set for the next

options.title: Learn React Native
options.more_info: Getting started with React Native after going through this order would be a lot easier and faster. You'd barely need a day
